metadata.synopsis: The Dark Urge accepted Bhaal when he appeared. Now, Jaheira and Minsc challenge and try to take down the DU, if they were encountered and survived until this point in the game.If the Jaheira/Minsc scene cannot trigger, there will be fallback comments from the party.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 0) Start with Dark Urge Origin.1) With the debugbook, go to Act 3 -> Undercity -> Bhaal Temple -> Bhaal Temple Bridge.2) Defeat Orin.3) Accept Bhaal's demands.

78.speaker: Minsc
78.text: Do not look, Boo. It is no longer our friend who stands there.
78.context: NodeContext: Genuinely broken-hearted that we accepted Bhaal (leaves with Jaheira, to ambush us outside)

36.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
36.text: All is nothing to me, beside Father.

29.speaker: Jaheira
29.text: Drop that stone. You will want your hands free for what comes next.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holding Nether stone/Dagger prop from Orin

12.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
12.text: Out of my way! You look upon a god.

3.speaker: Minsc
3.text: Boo knows many gods. You don't look like any of them.

59.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
59.text: This stone gives control over the Absolute. It must be mine.

82.speaker: Jaheira
82.text: Without you, there would be no Absolute. This was all your doing.

74.speaker: Minsc
74.text: And Minsc shall be your undoing!

62.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
62.text: Let's not fight, I didn't want any of this.

93.speaker: Minsc
93.text: You can lie to Minsc. Perhaps even to Jaheira. But not to Boo.
93.context: NodeContext: Sadly - he'll fight us to the death but he didn't want it to come to this

32.speaker: Jaheira
32.text: You have what you wanted, Chosen. And now you will see exactly what that means.

52.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
52.text: Bhaal was going to kill me if I didn't accept!

13.speaker: Jaheira
13.text: And you could have embraced death with a smile. Few are given such a choice.

7.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
7.text: You don't understand. I'm not an evil person.

70.speaker: Minsc
70.text: Boo and I - we once hoped that that was true. But no longer.

119.speaker: Jaheira
119.text: Who is this performance for, Bhaalspawn? It is only us here - you need not pretend.

53.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
53.text: I don't want you to die. I want you to serve.

117.speaker: Jaheira
117.text: Then I am afraid you don't know us at all - as we never truly knew you.

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *You feel a tug of recognition - Minsc's unwitting mind, mingled tides of anger, grief, confusion. Friends and enemies, melding beyond recognition.*

81.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
81.text: Ease his confusion. Try to control him.

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *A simple command. Your tadpole provides the means, your bloodline the message: to end these petty mortals who plague your Father.*

21.speaker: Jaheira
21.text: No more threats? I admit, I was hoping for -

95.context: CinematicNodeContext: A rasp of steel, and Jaheira stops short with a wet gasp - then falls forward, revealing Minsc holding his bloodied sword. The mind-meld dissipates, and he looks at her body with growing horror. Then to us, rage and grief building.

94.speaker: Minsc
94.text: What did I - ? What did you make Minsc do?!

72.speaker: Jaheira
72.text: You have won Bhaal's bloody blessing. Now you think you will step out into the world, and carve your name upon it.

114.speaker: Jaheira
114.text: Minsc and I, we know better. We stood here a century ago, and watched this same ceremony unfold. We stand here again to show you how it ends:

69.speaker: Jaheira
69.text: I know better. I stood here a century ago, and watched this same ceremony unfold. I stand here again to show you how it ends:

4.speaker: Jaheira
4.text: With your bones rotting beneath your father's hall - your name remembered by none.

76.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
76.text: You really think you can kill me? ME? The Slayer-King!

16.speaker: Minsc
16.text: We have slain kings. And gods. And one time, a giant. But never before a friend.

8.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
8.text: Cowards! You waited until I did all the dirty work.

14.speaker: Minsc
14.text: Jaheira hoped there was still some flimsy light of good within you, small as Boo but just as bright.

86.speaker: Jaheira
86.text: What about you? Will you protect the world from what they have become?

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: I really hoped we could avoid being pawns for a dark god, but here we are, I suppose.

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: I'm with you, my dear. Wherever this leads.

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: I thought I'd saved you from Bhaal's clutches. Seems I failed, damn it all.

77.speaker: Wyll
77.text: I will mourn the person you were. But I will not accept the one you've become.

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: I tried once before... but it seems Bhaal has too tight a grasp on you.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: Still though, I won't leave. There's a good person in there somewhere.

30.speaker: Gale
30.text: There is nothing more to be said, but a final goodbye.

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: I tried to save you - when Bhaal came for you before, I stood by you.

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: And I stand beside you now. I know you. You're more than this. More than Bhaal. You're my friend, and I won't leave you.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: But... but this? I can't pardon this. I can't fix this. This is it. It's over.

107.speaker: Lae'zel
107.text: I tried to save you from the Lord of Murder - and still you gave in.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: Damn you. I cannot turn my back. I will not.

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: I tried to wrest you from Bhaal's grip once already. Seems I failed.

22.speaker: Shadowheart
22.text: But I won't give up on you - not just yet. I'm my own worst enemy in that regard.

105.speaker: Jaheira
105.text: Goodbye, Bhaalspawn. Harpers, to arms. Let's defend this city as we always have.

26.speaker: Minsc
26.text: Boo and Minsc promise to make it swift, evil.

37.speaker: Minsc
37.text: Jaheira... must it truly be this way?
37.context: NodeContext: Minsc almost sobbing, he is very erluctant

106.speaker: Jaheira
106.text: This path was not of our choosing, Minsc. But we must walk it all the same.
106.context: NodeContext: Gentle, but resolute - Minsc doesn't want to kill us and Jaheira understands, but she knows we're too far gone

6.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
6.text: None shall stand in my way.

46.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
46.text: Bhaal below, I thought I got rid of you.

104.speaker: Jaheira
104.text: Only a respite. Do not forget who knows the Bhaalspawn better than any alive. Your path only ever led one way.

113.speaker: Minsc
113.text: Boo and I - we prayed it would be Orin who prevailed. It would make the slaughter to come a little gentler.

44.speaker: Captain Leafsong
44.text: Greetings, Bhaalspawn. I hoped to see the High Harper walk out those doors with you.
44.context: NodeContext: Grim formality. He's there as a backup plan of Jaheira's in case we went rabid - and the fact that she's not with us is proof enough she's dead, and he has to fight us.

38.speaker: Captain Leafsong
38.text: But if she hasn't... well, we'll mourn her later. She gave us a job to do.
38.context: NodeContext: Grim formality. He's there as a backup plan of Jaheira's in case we went rabid - and the fact that she's not with us is proof enough she's dead, and he has to fight us.

51.speaker: Jaheira
51.context: NodeContext: Utter fury, all the worse because she's keeping it restrained.

20.speaker: Jaheira
20.text: Live with it, if you can - I will not.
20.context: NodeContext: Quiet, barely restrained disgust - leaves after.

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *The stone trembles with evils, warm as Father's hate.*
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holding Nether stone/Dagger prop from Orin

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: The Lord of Murder calls you. You know what your answer must be.

28.speaker: Karlach
28.text: You can hear him, can't you? The Lord of Murder. You can hear, but you won't listen. I know you won't.

116.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
116.text: Fall in line. We leave, now.

84.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
84.text: Of course, I didn't mean a word I said to Bhaal.

58.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
58.text: I shall use the stone well, I promise.

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *Unease fills the Bhaal Temple's stagnant air.*

88.speaker: GROUP_ORI_DU
88.text: We should all begin to pray.

54.speaker: Wyll
54.text: Think carefully. Do not give yourself to the Dread Lord, no matter how strong your cravings.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: Careful what you do with that thing...

103.speaker: Gale
103.text: He calls to you, doesn't he? Bhaal. Resist him - to rule in his name would be to lose who you truly are.

111.speaker: Astarion
111.text: I really hope you know what you're doing.

118.speaker: Halsin
118.text: Yours are not the hands in which I would have placed such terrible power. Think carefully on your next action, please.

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *Another part of your glimmering birthright, for you to abuse as you please.*

97.speaker: Jaheira
97.text: You've chosen the company you keep - I will not allow the Bhaalspawn to hide behind you.
97.context: NodeContext: Grim, ready to kill us - not apologetic, but explaining that we've brought this on ourselves.

75.speaker: Jaheira
75.text: Harpers - let us do what we must.
75.context: NodeContext: Authorative order to the Harpers she's gathered - to kill the party.
